title: On the stochastics of human and artificial creativity
abstract: arXiv:2403.06996v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: What constitutes human creativity, and is it possible for computers to exhibit genuine creativity? We argue that achieving human-level intelligence in computers, or so-called Artificial General Intelligence, necessitates attaining also human-level creativity. We contribute to this discussion by developing a statistical representation of human creativity, incorporating prior insights from stochastic theory, psychology, philosophy, neuroscience, and chaos theory. This highlights the stochastic nature of the human creative process, which includes both a bias guided, random proposal step, and an evaluation step depending on a flexible or transformable bias structure. The acquired representation of human creativity is subsequently used to assess the creativity levels of various contemporary AI systems. translated_title: 论人类和人工创造力的随机性
translated_abstract: 什么构成人类创造力，计算机是否能够展现真正的创造力？我们认为，要实现计算机的人类水平智能，或者所谓的人工通用智能，必须同时达到人类水平的创造力。我们通过开发人类创造力的统计表征，结合随机理论、心理学、哲学、神经科学和混沌理论的先前见解，为这一讨论做出贡献。这突显了人类创造过程的随机性质，其中包括一个有偏向导向的随机提案步骤，以及依赖于灵活或可变偏向结构的评估步骤。获得的人类创造力表征随后被用来评估各种当代人工智能系统的创造力水平。我们的分析包括现代人工智能算法，如强化学习、扩散模型和大型语言模型，探讨了这些算法在多大程度上实现了人类创造力的水平。
tldr: 论文通过统计表征人类创造力，结合多个领域的先前见解，突出人类创造过程中的随机性质，并利用这一表征评估当代人工智能系统的创造力水平。
en_tdlr: The paper develops a statistical representation of human creativity by incorporating insights from various fields, highlighting the stochastic nature of the human creative process, and uses this representation to assess the creativity levels of contemporary AI systems.
